author: jsign
content:
In the client I created for the ceremony, I created a separate `verify-transcript` command that pulls the transcript from the sequencer and do some checks to know if things are looking ok.
It validates that all the `potPubkeys` in the transcript (there's one per contribution), form a valid tau first power. This is done taking the `runningProducts` present in the transcript, and doing the pairing checks with all encrypted secrets from contribution.

That validation proves that the "tau first power" is indeed the multiplication of each contribution secret. With that, at least you're sure the first power is correctly calculated.

After that, I double check that the rest of the powers are coherent with that taus first power, so t^2, t^3, ... etc are the correct powers of tau.

If you want to run the client `verify-transcript` yourself, it's quite easy, see -> https://github.com/jsign/go-kzg-ceremony-client#verify-the-current-sequencer-transcript-ourselves

author: potuz
content: Thanks, this is precisely what I wanted. This and the appearance of my contribution in the transcript is enough to make this trustless

author: kevaundray
content:
Attesting is a two step process, the first step while the ceremony is ongoing is attesting to contributing and the second step once the ceremony has completed is attesting that your contribution has been included in the final state.

The sequencer _could_ accept your contribution while the ceremony is ongoing and then once it is completed, produce a state which does not include your contribution
